Ten years after the migration crisis, Germany assesses Merkel's 'Wir schaffen das' legacy
description: 'We will manage,' Chancellor Angela Merkel declared on August 31, 2015, as hundreds of thousands of refugees, particularly from Syria, sought asylum in the country. Studies show her proactive integration policy has yielded positive results, even though the issue remains divisive.

description: Meeting in Copenhagen on Saturday, the EU's foreign ministers failed to reach agreement on any of the proposals under discussion.

headline: Andriy Parubiy, former speaker of parliament killed in Lviv, was a figurehead of Ukrainian nationalism
description: Police in the western Ukrainian city have launched a manhunt for the shooter. Parubiy took part in the 2004-2005 'Orange Revolution' and led the self-defense forces that confronted riot police on Maidan Square in 2014.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by group activities
description: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she explores how to mingle your fantasies with those of others, through erotic literature, nude drawing, or at a libertine club.

headline: Evangelicalism in France continues to grow, driven by conversions
description: Members of evangelical churches, a branch of Protestantism, are increasing. These believers say they are drawn by a more informal liturgy and the emphasis on community.

headline: The letters from two Ukrainian sisters: 'I'm almost grateful I experienced the attacks. Now I know what my loved ones go through'
description: Olga and Sasha Kurovska are two Ukrainian sisters. One lives in Paris, the other lives in Kyiv. When Olga joined her sister and their parents in the Ukrainian capital for the holidays, she endured Russian strikes, including on the harrowing night of August 27.

headline: Is France's debt situation as worrying as PM François Bayrou claims?
description: The French prime minister justifies the €44 billion in budgetary efforts he is demanding for 2026 by citing the worrying state of public finances. But is the situation really that dire?
